case_title: REFERENCE MADE BY DISTRICT AND SESSIONS JUDGE, KARACHI vs THE STATE

accussed_details.name: Syed Abdullah Shah
allegation: Involvement in alleged murder of Mir Murtaza Bhutto

accussed_details.name: Senator Asif Ali Zardari
allegation: Involvement in alleged murder of Mir Murtaza Bhutto

complaint_summary: The case pertains to the alleged murder of Mir Murtaza Bhutto, with Syed Abdullah Shah and Senator Asif Ali Zardari named as accused.
investigation_summary: The investigation faced delays due to late submission of challan and prolonged witness examinations. Only two witnesses were examined out of 223 in two years.
judgment_summary: The Sindh High Court ordered the transfer of the case to Ms. Yasmin Abbasi, District and Sessions Judge, Karachi West, citing sensitivity and convenience. The transferee court was directed to proceed day-to-day, report progress fortnightly, and conclude within six months.
Decision_or_verdict: Case transferred to Ms. Yasmin Abbasi, District and Sessions Judge, Karachi West.
legal_arguments: Section 526(1)(a) Cr.P.C.: Fair and impartial inquiry or trial cannot be held.
Section 526(1)(c) Cr.P.C.: Transfer expedient for the ends of justice.

legal_terms.challan: Formal charge sheet submitted by police
legal_terms.cross-examination: Questioning of witnesses by opposing counsel

words_and_phrases.expedient: Suitable for achieving a particular end

summary_vector_notes: The case involves the alleged murder of Mir Murtaza Bhutto, with Syed Abdullah Shah and Senator Asif Ali Zardari named as accused. The Sindh High Court transferred the case to Ms. Yasmin Abbasi, citing judicial sensitivity and convenience. The court directed expedited proceedings to conclude within six months. Delays were attributed to late challan submission and prolonged witness examinations.

subsections: 526(1)(a): Fair and impartial inquiry or trial cannot be held in any Criminal Court subordinate to the High Court.
526(1)(c): Order sought is expedient for the ends of justice or required by any provision of the Code.

key_points.reason_for_transfer: Personal reservations of the Sessions Judge regarding involvement of Syed Abdullah Shah and Senator Asif Ali Zardari as accused.
key_points.transfer_decision: Ms. Yasmin Abbasi, District and Sessions Judge, Karachi West, appointed to handle the case.
key_points.witnesses: 223 witnesses involved, only 2 examined over two years.
key_points.instructions_to_transferee_court: Proceed with the case day-to-day and conclude within six months, reporting progress fortnightly.

additional_notes.sensitivity_of_case: Case involves complexities and sensitivity due to high-profile accused and large number of witnesses.
additional_notes.location_of_trial: Trial to remain in Karachi for convenience.
